content.description: Great climbing that involves some finger locks, crimps, jugs, and reaches. On great rock with a thoughtful topout.

Easy climbing on good ledges leads to a fun topout. Climb up the featured rock until you reach a small tree growing out of a notch. Climb right, around the tree, to a ledge, and up to the top of the boulder.
content.location: On the left side of the main face, start on a featured face, just left of a small tree growing out of a notch, about 10 feet overhead.

content.description: Fun and thoughtful face climbing on small edges, which climbs the cleanest section of the wall. Top out at the apex of the wall.
content.location: Start 4 ft left of the obvious crack that is the start of The Jeweler, on a blank looking face. Delicately climb up on small crimps and sidepulls to an exciting finish.

content.description: This is the largest boulder in the Preserve and worth the hike. It's unlikely to see much traffic and with the main face being adjacent to the "mossy falls", it would be a good idea to bring a brush as moss and lichens reclaim the face. The main face is also right on the trail so make sure not to sprawl and be conscientious of hikers. The main face is about 20 ft tall. The rock quality is good but still be wary of crystals that may break, especially near the top.
